meanings.definition: to teach someone or provide knowledge
meanings.sentence: The program aims to educate young people about healthy eating.

meanings.definition: exact and accurate in every detail
meanings.sentence: The engineer provided precise measurements for the design.

meanings.definition: to follow the progress or development of something
meanings.sentence: She tracks her fitness goals with a mobile app.

meanings.definition: a history of past performance or achievements
meanings.sentence: The company's track record in delivering projects on time is impressive.

meanings.definition: to obtain something
meanings.sentence: She needs to get more information before deciding.

meanings.definition: to contact someone, for example by phone or email
meanings.sentence: I need to get in touch with my professor about the assignment.

meanings.definition: to move toward or arrive at a place
meanings.sentence: They asked him to come to the party on Friday.

meanings.definition: to happen, especially unexpectedly
meanings.sentence: If any problems come up during the project, tell me immediately.

meanings.definition: Having a stale or moldy smell
meanings.sentence: The old basement smelled musty after years of being closed.

meanings.definition: To shock or surprise someone greatly
meanings.sentence: The sudden news of his promotion stunned him.

meanings.definition: Extremely attractive or impressive
meanings.sentence: She wore a stunning dress to the gala that everyone admired.

meanings.definition: To force air out through the mouth
meanings.sentence: She blew out the candles on her birthday cake.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more important than it is
meanings.sentence: The media often overblow small controversies into major scandals.

meanings.definition: A public disagreement about an important topic
meanings.sentence: The plan to build a new airport caused a major controversy among residents.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel intimidated or nervous.
meanings.sentence: The difficulty of the exam did not daunt her, and she passed with high marks.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel worried or less confident
meanings.sentence: Preparing for the presentation was a daunting task for the new employee.

meanings.definition: The inner sense of what is right or wrong
meanings.sentence: Her conscience told her to apologize for the mistake.

meanings.definition: careful to do tasks thoroughly and correctly
meanings.sentence: She is very conscientious about completing her assignments on time.

meanings.definition: Fair and reasonable according to what is right
meanings.sentence: It seemed conscionable to apologize for the mistake.

meanings.definition: to look at something carefully to learn more about it
meanings.sentence: The teacher will examine each student’s essay before grading.

meanings.definition: someone who inspects or tests knowledge or quality
meanings.sentence: The examiner checked the students’ answers carefully.

meanings.definition: a formal test of a person's knowledge or skill
meanings.sentence: I studied all week for the examination tomorrow.

meanings.definition: to question someone thoroughly, especially in court
meanings.sentence: The attorney will cross-examine the witness during the trial.

meanings.definition: two similar or matching things considered together
meanings.sentence: She bought a new pair of shoes.

meanings.definition: to make something weaker or less effective
meanings.sentence: Loud noise can impair your hearing over time.

meanings.definition: a loss or weakness of a particular ability
meanings.sentence: His visual impairment makes reading difficult.

meanings.definition: to use or spend time, effort, or money
meanings.sentence: They expended a lot of effort to finish the project on time.

meanings.definition: the amount of money spent on something
meanings.sentence: My monthly expenditure on groceries was higher than usual.

meanings.definition: not essential and able to be replaced
meanings.sentence: Extra supplies were considered expendable when packing for the trip.

meanings.definition: come before something in time or order
meanings.sentence: A brief overview will precede the detailed report.

meanings.definition: previous decision used as a guide for future cases
meanings.sentence: The ruling set a precedent that lower courts must follow.

meanings.definition: higher priority or importance over others
meanings.sentence: Safety takes precedence over speed during construction.

meanings.definition: To win or be more successful than opponents.
meanings.sentence: They worked hard and eventually prevailed in the competition.

meanings.definition: The state of being widespread or common.
meanings.sentence: The prevalence of smartphones has changed how people communicate.

meanings.definition: To consider something when making a decision.
meanings.sentence: When planning the event, you must take into account the weather forecast.

meanings.definition: Likely to be affected by or suffer from something.
meanings.sentence: She is prone to making mistakes when she hurries.

meanings.definition: A treatment that cures a disease or problem.
meanings.sentence: He found a natural remedy for his headache.

meanings.definition: The act of correcting or improving something.
meanings.sentence: The company began soil remediation to clean up the polluted land.

meanings.definition: Intended to improve skills in areas of weakness.
meanings.sentence: She attended a remedial math course to strengthen her algebra skills.

meanings.definition: Capable of being fixed or corrected.
meanings.sentence: The errors in the report are remediable if we review the data carefully.

meanings.definition: to make something last longer
meanings.sentence: They prolonged the meeting to discuss the budget changes.

meanings.definition: the act of making something last longer
meanings.sentence: The prolongation of the event gave everyone more time to prepare.

meanings.definition: able to be made longer in duration
meanings.sentence: The warranty is prolongable if you purchase the extended plan.

meanings.definition: important and well known
meanings.sentence: She played a prominent role in the project.

meanings.definition: the state of being important or well known
meanings.sentence: He gained prominence after winning the award.

meanings.definition: firmly fixed; not changing or wavering
meanings.sentence: The ladder remained steady as she climbed to the roof.

meanings.definition: to copy someone’s actions or behavior
meanings.sentence: Children often imitate their parents’ behavior.

meanings.definition: to make cloth by interlacing threads on a loom
meanings.sentence: My grandmother taught me how to weave a colorful blanket.

meanings.definition: made by weaving threads together
meanings.sentence: She admired the beautifully woven basket at the craft fair.

meanings.definition: to read something quickly to get the main points
meanings.sentence: He skimmed the report to find the key figures.

meanings.definition: a large number of things placed on top of each other
meanings.sentence: She found a pile of books on her desk.

meanings.definition: tasting very good
meanings.sentence: The homemade cookies were absolutely yummy.

meanings.definition: holding firmly to a purpose or opinion
meanings.sentence: Her tenacious spirit helped her complete the project on time.

meanings.definition: the quality of being very determined
meanings.sentence: Her tenacity helped her overcome every challenge.

meanings.definition: memorizing information by repetition without understanding
meanings.sentence: Students often rely on rote learning to remember vocabulary lists.

meanings.definition: Liquid and dripping easily.
meanings.sentence: The sauce was too runny to serve on the plate.

meanings.definition: to meet someone unexpectedly
meanings.sentence: I ran into an old friend at the supermarket yesterday.

meanings.definition: An amount that is more than needed or allowed.
meanings.sentence: She donated the excess food to the local shelter.

meanings.definition: More than necessary or reasonable.
meanings.sentence: She received an excessive number of emails after signing up.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel very excited and happy.
meanings.sentence: The mountain view will exhilarate anyone who sees it.

meanings.definition: A feeling of great happiness and excitement.
meanings.sentence: After hearing the good news, she was filled with exhilaration.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel very excited and happy.
meanings.sentence: The roller-coaster ride was so exhilarating that she screamed with joy.

meanings.definition: Clear and direct, leaving no room for confusion.
meanings.sentence: The teacher gave explicit instructions for the assignment.

meanings.definition: Stylish and fashionable.
meanings.sentence: She wore a chic dress to the party.

meanings.definition: a small piece broken off something hard
meanings.sentence: There was a chip on the edge of the plate.

meanings.definition: a shop that sells fish and chips
meanings.sentence: Let’s get dinner from the chippy tonight.

meanings.definition: broke a small piece off something hard
meanings.sentence: She chipped the plate when she dropped it.

meanings.definition: to get up from sleep or from a lying position
meanings.sentence: I usually arise early to go for a run.

meanings.definition: to mix two or more substances thoroughly
meanings.sentence: She likes to blend fruits into her morning smoothie.

meanings.definition: a machine that mixes or purees food and drinks
meanings.sentence: I used the blender to make a strawberry milkshake.

meanings.definition: to produce flowers
meanings.sentence: The cherry trees bloom in spring.

meanings.definition: producing flowers, especially in plants
meanings.sentence: The roses are blooming in the garden.

meanings.definition: to break open or apart suddenly
meanings.sentence: The balloon burst with a loud pop.

meanings.definition: to suddenly start doing something
meanings.sentence: She burst into laughter during the movie.

meanings.definition: to suddenly start doing something loudly
meanings.sentence: She burst out laughing at the joke.

meanings.definition: to suddenly open by force or pressure
meanings.sentence: The door burst open during the storm.

meanings.definition: a person whose job is to cut and sell meat
meanings.sentence: I went to the butcher to buy fresh chicken.

meanings.definition: a shop where meat is prepared and sold
meanings.sentence: We bought fresh pork at the local butchery.

meanings.definition: a large sharp knife used to cut meat
meanings.sentence: He used a butcher knife to slice the roast beef.

meanings.definition: to fail an exam or course
meanings.sentence: He didn’t study and flunked his history test.

meanings.definition: to become red in the face
meanings.sentence: She flushed when she heard the compliment.

meanings.definition: to be on your feet in an upright position
meanings.sentence: She had to stand during the whole concert.

meanings.definition: a person present at an event but not involved
meanings.sentence: A bystander witnessed the accident but did not help.

meanings.definition: a person you regularly write letters to, especially in another place
meanings.sentence: I have a pen friend in Japan who sends me letters every month.

meanings.definition: unsure or unwilling to act immediately
meanings.sentence: She was hesitant to answer the question in front of the class.

meanings.definition: feel or show sadness for someone’s death
meanings.sentence: The whole family mourned her loss deeply.

meanings.definition: a long, pointed weapon used for thrusting or throwing
meanings.sentence: The hunter used a spear to catch his dinner.

meanings.definition: a person who gives care to someone who is ill or old
meanings.sentence: The caregiver helped her grandmother with daily tasks after her surgery.

meanings.definition: arouse curiosity or interest
meanings.sentence: The mysterious book cover intrigued her, so she decided to read it.

meanings.definition: very interested and curious about something
meanings.sentence: He was intrigued by the unusual painting in the gallery.

meanings.definition: covered with or consisting of sticky, dirty substance
meanings.sentence: My shoes got gunky after I walked through the muddy path.

meanings.definition: strong and solid; unlikely to break or be damaged
meanings.sentence: The sturdy table held all of the heavy books easily.

meanings.definition: a small amount of something
meanings.sentence: She showed a modicum of patience with the children.

meanings.definition: nervous or tense and easily upset
meanings.sentence: She always feels uptight before taking exams.

meanings.definition: deep sadness caused by loss or death
meanings.sentence: He experienced intense grief after his grandfather died.

meanings.definition: suspicious or not quite honest
meanings.sentence: His explanation sounded hinky, so I didn’t trust it.

meanings.definition: a belief or custom passed down within a group
meanings.sentence: In our family, it is a tradition to eat pancakes for breakfast on Sundays.

meanings.definition: an informal term for an old man
meanings.sentence: That old geezer down the street always sits on his porch in the afternoon.

meanings.definition: a slight degree of color added to something
meanings.sentence: She added a blue tint to the white paint.

meanings.definition: a cleaning tool with a long handle and absorbent head
meanings.sentence: She used a mop to wipe the kitchen floor.

meanings.definition: to clean or absorb liquid from a surface
meanings.sentence: After the spill, she used a cloth to mop up the water.

meanings.definition: look quickly and secretly
meanings.sentence: She managed to peep through the keyhole to see who was inside.

meanings.definition: press something firmly from opposite sides
meanings.sentence: She squeezed the juice from the lemon into the bowl.

meanings.definition: faithfulness to a person, cause, or belief
meanings.sentence: Their long marriage was built on mutual respect and fidelity.

meanings.definition: unfaithfulness in a marriage or relationship
meanings.sentence: Her discovery of his infidelity led to their separation.

meanings.definition: beat a liquid food until it becomes light and fluffy
meanings.sentence: She used a whisk to whip the cream for the dessert.

meanings.definition: beaten until light and fluffy
meanings.sentence: She topped her hot chocolate with a dollop of whipped cream.

meanings.definition: deal effectively with a difficult situation
meanings.sentence: He found it hard at first, but he eventually learned to cope with the stress.

meanings.definition: manage a difficult situation or problem
meanings.sentence: She had to cope with a lot of stress at her new job.

meanings.definition: seek advice or information from someone
meanings.sentence: She decided to consult her teacher before starting the project.

meanings.definition: seek advice or information from someone
meanings.sentence: Before making a decision, she decided to consult with her mentor.

meanings.definition: look at and understand written words
meanings.sentence: I read a chapter of my book before bed.

meanings.definition: read a text in order to correct mistakes
meanings.sentence: She proofread her essay before submitting it.

meanings.definition: a person confined in a prison or similar institution
meanings.sentence: The inmate spent his days reading books in the prison library.

meanings.definition: to throw food and liquid up from the stomach
meanings.sentence: He felt so sick that he puked after the roller-coaster ride.

meanings.definition: the dead body of a person
meanings.sentence: The detectives covered the corpse before taking it to the morgue.

meanings.definition: to move gently back and forth or from side to side
meanings.sentence: The boat rocked gently on the waves.

meanings.definition: to choose not to do something, especially something enjoyable
meanings.sentence: She decided to abstain from eating sweets for a month.

meanings.definition: the act of choosing not to vote or participate
meanings.sentence: There were several abstentions during the council’s decision.

meanings.definition: to lose something as a result of a rule or mistake
meanings.sentence: They had to forfeit the game after using an ineligible player.

meanings.definition: having the right to do or receive something
meanings.sentence: Only students with good grades are eligible for the scholarship.

meanings.definition: not allowed to do or receive something
meanings.sentence: She was ineligible to vote because she had not registered.

meanings.definition: a person killed or injured in an accident or war
meanings.sentence: The earthquake caused hundreds of casualties in the city.

meanings.definition: an act of violent or open resistance to an authority
meanings.sentence: The villagers' rebellion against the governor failed quickly.

meanings.definition: to organize and present a performance or event
meanings.sentence: The school will stage a play in the auditorium next week.

meanings.definition: to attract or persuade someone to do something by offering something appealing
meanings.sentence: The company hopes to lure new customers with special discounts.

meanings.definition: to persuade someone to come out from hiding
meanings.sentence: The police used a loudspeaker to lure the suspect out of the house.

meanings.definition: showing a strong desire to punish someone for a wrong
meanings.sentence: After the argument, he felt vengeful and refused to speak to her.

meanings.definition: to stay in one place in the air
meanings.sentence: A hummingbird hovered near the flowers to drink nectar.

meanings.definition: to move slowly and quietly
meanings.sentence: The cat crept along the fence at night.

meanings.definition: to make someone feel nervous or scared
meanings.sentence: The silent doll in the corner really creeps me out.

meanings.definition: a tool used to turn screws
meanings.sentence: I used a screwdriver to tighten the loose handle on the door.

meanings.definition: unkind or unpleasant
meanings.sentence: Don’t be so mean—you hurt her feelings.

meanings.definition: to spend time doing nothing
meanings.sentence: We can’t just sit around all day—let’s find something to do.

meanings.definition: A loud and unpleasant noise
meanings.sentence: The children made such a racket that I couldn't concentrate on my work.

meanings.definition: Awkward in movement or handling things
meanings.sentence: He is so clumsy that he always drops his phone.

meanings.definition: A game where players hide while another tries to find them
meanings.sentence: The children played hide and seek in the backyard.

meanings.definition: in a very short time
meanings.sentence: I'll be with you momentarily.

meanings.definition: a person who is weak or easily frightened
meanings.sentence: He felt like a wimp for not standing up for himself.

meanings.definition: to push a sharp object into something or someone
meanings.sentence: She stabbed the meat to check if it was cooked.

meanings.definition: a person who takes advantage of others’ generosity
meanings.sentence: He’s such a freeloader, always joining us for meals without offering to help.

meanings.definition: an injury to a joint caused by twisting
meanings.sentence: She got a sprain in her ankle during the game.

meanings.definition: injured by twisting a joint
meanings.sentence: She sprained her ankle during the match.

meanings.definition: a break or crack in a bone
meanings.sentence: He had a hairline fracture in his wrist after falling.

meanings.definition: broken a bone
meanings.sentence: He fractured his wrist in the fall.

meanings.definition: to drink something quickly in large gulps
meanings.sentence: He chugged the soda in seconds.

meanings.definition: an old woman who is unpleasant or frightening
meanings.sentence: In the fairy tale, the witch appeared as a scary hag.

meanings.definition: to throw something with force
meanings.sentence: He flung the stone into the lake.

meanings.definition: full of or covered with stars
meanings.sentence: The sky was starry and clear tonight.

meanings.definition: the regular rise and fall of the sea
meanings.sentence: They watched the tide come in at the beach.

meanings.definition: to crush something into a fine powder
meanings.sentence: The machine can pulverize rocks into sand.

meanings.definition: to cut something into pieces with a sharp tool
meanings.sentence: Please chop the onions before adding them to the soup.

meanings.definition: a tool used for chopping
meanings.sentence: He used a chopper to split the firewood.

meanings.definition: a natural area left in its raw state
meanings.sentence: They spent the weekend camping in the wilderness.

meanings.definition: to try to please someone for personal gain
meanings.sentence: She always sucks up to her manager to get special favors.

meanings.definition: to support or maintain a decision or principle
meanings.sentence: The committee upheld the original agreement despite objections.

meanings.definition: to make a soft, gentle sound like a dove
meanings.sentence: The mother cooed softly to calm her crying baby.

meanings.definition: of the highest quality
meanings.sentence: Her performance was top notch and impressed everyone.

meanings.definition: suggesting that something bad will happen
meanings.sentence: The dark clouds gave the landscape an ominous look.

meanings.definition: serious and sad in mood
meanings.sentence: The ceremony was somber and respectful.

meanings.definition: in a silly or unwise manner
meanings.sentence: He foolishly ignored the warning signs.

meanings.definition: to stop breathing or have difficulty breathing because of a blocked throat
meanings.sentence: He choked on a piece of meat.

meanings.definition: a game in which you jump over a swinging rope
meanings.sentence: The children took turns using the jump rope at recess.

meanings.definition: Strange in a way that causes fear or unease.
meanings.sentence: The abandoned house had an eerie silence at night.

meanings.definition: Showing mental decline due to old age.
meanings.sentence: At times, his forgetfulness made him seem senile to his family.

meanings.definition: to bring someone or something back to life
meanings.sentence: In the legend, the sorcerer tried to resurrect the fallen king.

meanings.definition: the act of bringing someone back to life
meanings.sentence: The novel tells of the resurrection of an ancient king.

meanings.definition: a strong feeling of shock and anger
meanings.sentence: The community expressed outrage when they learned about the unfair policy.

meanings.definition: very shocking and unacceptable
meanings.sentence: It is outrageous that you have to pay so much for parking.

meanings.definition: to obtain something by force or threats
meanings.sentence: The gang tried to extort money from local shop owners.

meanings.definition: the act of getting money by force or threats
meanings.sentence: The company reported a case of extortion when a hacker demanded payment.

meanings.definition: to push or drive something forward
meanings.sentence: The strong wind helped propel the boat across the lake.

meanings.definition: the force that pushes an object forward
meanings.sentence: The rocket’s propulsion system uses powerful engines.

meanings.definition: a large meal, often for a special occasion
meanings.sentence: They prepared a feast for the holiday dinner.

meanings.definition: a low stool for resting your feet
meanings.sentence: She put her feet up on the footstool while reading.

meanings.definition: a curved piece of metal for catching or holding things
meanings.sentence: He hung his coat on a hook by the door.

meanings.definition: the upper part of the body containing the brain
meanings.sentence: He nodded his head in agreement.

meanings.definition: to dig into food means to start eating it eagerly
meanings.sentence: We dig into our meals as soon as they arrive.

meanings.definition: a person who is addicted to drugs
meanings.sentence: He was a junkie who needed drugs every day.

meanings.definition: the degree or range to which something applies or happens
meanings.sentence: She didn't realize the full extent of the damage.

meanings.definition: to officially suggest someone for a position or award
meanings.sentence: The committee will nominate her for the leadership role next week.

meanings.definition: an uneasy feeling that something bad will happen
meanings.sentence: She felt a foreboding before the storm.

meanings.definition: calm and sensible in difficult situations
meanings.sentence: She remained level-headed during the crisis.

meanings.definition: in an unsteady or insecure way
meanings.sentence: He tried to draw a straight line but his hand moved shaky.

meanings.definition: mentally unstable or crazy
meanings.sentence: That loony idea will never work in practice.

meanings.definition: to deceive someone by pretending strength or confidence
meanings.sentence: She tried to bluff her way through the tough questions.

meanings.definition: a person who is mentally unstable or acts crazy
meanings.sentence: Don’t mind him; he’s a total nutjob sometimes.

meanings.definition: an insulting word for a very unpleasant or stupid person
meanings.sentence: He called his neighbor a shithead after the argument.

meanings.definition: to make secret or dishonest plans
meanings.sentence: They schemed to take over the company.

meanings.definition: a game where players use rock, paper, or scissors hand shapes
meanings.sentence: They settled the dispute with a game of rock paper scissors.

meanings.definition: something that is needed
meanings.sentence: Clean water is a necessity for good health.

meanings.definition: the act of allowing yourself something enjoyable
meanings.sentence: Reading a novel at the café was her favorite indulgence.

meanings.definition: awkward in movement or action
meanings.sentence: She felt clumsy on the ice and kept slipping.

meanings.definition: behaviour of spending much more than necessary
meanings.sentence: She admired the extravagance of the palace decorations.

meanings.definition: absolutely necessary or essential
meanings.sentence: A reliable internet connection is indispensable for working from home.

meanings.definition: to base something on a particular idea or fact
meanings.sentence: He stands on his experience to make decisions.

meanings.definition: cheerful and full of energy
meanings.sentence: She felt perky after her morning run.

meanings.definition: your grandmother, especially in an affectionate way
meanings.sentence: My granny bakes the best chocolate chip cookies.

meanings.definition: to give a short, sharp cry, usually in pain or surprise
meanings.sentence: The dog yelped when it stepped on the thorn.

meanings.definition: a soft, wet mass of small pieces
meanings.sentence: She turned the strawberries into a smooth pulp.

meanings.definition: continuing firmly despite difficulties
meanings.sentence: Her persistent efforts finally led to success.

meanings.definition: a prison for serious criminals
meanings.sentence: He was sent to a federal penitentiary for his crime.

meanings.definition: to stumble because your foot hits something
meanings.sentence: Be careful not to trip on the loose carpet edge.

meanings.definition: to twist something into a tighter shape
meanings.sentence: She twisted up the paper to make a small ball.

meanings.definition: in addition; also
meanings.sentence: He speaks English and French as well.
